title: Unique quarters on Victorian estate, pets welcome
description:
This sunny apartment is on the second floor of MacCarrol Manor House with vintage Victorian details and views to flowering treetops. The apartment has two private entrances with deck and balcony; large rooms; big closets; an oak fireplace; a great flexible layout -- and a bonus room that could be an office, nursery, or maker's space, just bring your imagination! Pets welcome!
The apartment features large windows, 9ft. ceilings, ceiling fan, crown moldings, and custom paint. Take a long bubble bath in a lovely claw-foot tub in a bathroom featuring bead-board wainscoting and an amazing mosaic vanity.
North Wales is a gracious neighborhood dating to the original William Penn land grants. The location is in a blue-ribbon school district (North Penn), and close to Lansdale, Blue Bell, Harleysville, Souderton, Skippack, and Towamencin. It's near the new Einstein Medical Center, Merck, Rt 309, PA Turnpike, Rt 422, and the North Wales, Lansdale, and Pembrook train stations. Easy commute by car or train to Philadelphia for work or play.
Enjoy the region's fabulous shopping and restaurants for every price point. Close to King of Prussia Mall, Montgomery Mall, Philadelphia Premium Outlets, and Franklin Mills. Boutiques and dining abound in quaint settings such as historic Skippack Village and Peddlers Village. You can tempt lady luck at the Valley Forge casino. Or visit Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Wegman's Market, local farm stands and farm-to-table restaurants, and Assi, a major Asian market.
The area is steeped in history and natural beauty. Visit reenactments of the winter encampments at Valley Forge national park. The next day, hike up Hawk Mountain to picnic and watch red-tail hawks and bald eagles. The region has over 6,000 acres of public open green spaces and over 6O miles of nature walks, hiking, biking, and horseback trails.
This is a GREAT LOCATION! Nothing comes close to our combination of timeless rural charm, the tranquility of nature, modern comforts, and easy access to urban conveniences and nightlife.
Tenant pays electric, gas, and trash service; and cable/internet if desired. Landlord pays for water and sewer service, lawn care and landscaping. Plenty of off-street parking at no charge. Move-in costs are equivalent to first and last month's rent and a one-month security deposit.
Dogs and cats are welcome. There is no pet security deposit. A monthly charge of $50 per pet is collected as additional rent.
Smoking is not permitted in the MacCarrol Manor House.
PLEASE NOTE: We value your time. When you set up an appointment to lease, all adults who would live in the apartment should come along. Before contacting us, please map location for commuting times and distance to be sure it fits your needs. Prices and availability are subject to change without notice.
